1.title: Why Protests and Riots Work
1.subtitle: Riots are destructive, dangerous, and scary — but can lead to serious social reforms. To prevent more violent uprisings and protests, we need to take their causes seriously.

3.title: How to Be an Antiracist
3.subtitle: Ibram X. Kendi's concept of antiracism reenergizes and reshapes the conversation about racial justice in America—but even more fundamentally, points us toward liberating new ways of thinking about ourselves and each other.

4.title: Colorism in the Beauty Industry
4.subtitle: America has progressed tremendously over recent years in terms of racial inequality, but colorism remains to be seen on a global scale.

4.title: Post 21
4.subtitle: Post 21 was created by a Mother-Daughter duo who wanted a comprehensive marketplace that focused on products from Black-owned businesses. They felt strongly that there’s no reason why these products are consistently being discovered when they should be household names. So, they said let’s create the place we want to shop.

products.name: Ball is Life Dog Tag
products.description: Super cool, fun, and durable Pet ID Tags. There's a tag for you and your pet's personality! Comes with custom engraving, to make sure that your little one is never lost and can always find it's way home.

products.name: B is for Black Boy
products.description: B is for Black Boy was written to celebrate the awe-inspiring nature of the Black male. It speaks life into our Black boys and empowers them to manifest their highest potential. It's intended to author and assert positive representation of Black boys to all audiences.

products.name: Headband
products.description: Handmade upcycled padded headband, with satin ribbon on underside next to hair.

5.title: The Hate U Give
5.subtitle: Based on the best-selling novel, The Hate U Give tells the story of Starr Carter, who lives in two worlds: the poor, black neighborhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. This uneasy balance is shattered when she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman. Facing pressures from all sides, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what’s right.

5.title: Coily and Cute

6.title: The Bail Project
6.subtitle: The Bail Project™ National Revolving Bail Fund is on a mission to combat mass incarceration and reshape the pretrial system in the United States. 100% of online donations are used to bring people home. Since bail money comes back to us when cases close, we're able to recycle every dollar donated at least twice per year.

7.title: Civil Rights Act - Britannica
7.subtitle: Civil Rights Act, (1964), comprehensive U.S. legislation intended to end discrimination based on race, colour, religion, or national origin.

7.title: Understanding My Privilege
7.subtitle: University Chancellor, Susan E. Borrego, reflects on her life as an emancipated minor and dissects the emotionally charged conversation surrounding race relations in the United States. This raconteur uses her powerful first-person account of "White Privilege" and "Black Lives Matter" to underscore the responsibility each one of us has to bring about change.

Their advice on how to participate in ensuring freedom for everybody: join something, start something and "sharpen each other, so that we all can rise."

12.title: The Case for Reparations
12.subtitle: Two hundred fifty years of slavery. Ninety years of Jim Crow. Sixty years of separate but equal. Thirty-five years of racist housing policy. Until we reckon with our compounding moral debts, America will never be whole.

13.title: Classify White Supremacist Groups as Domestic Terrorist Organizations
13.subtitle: Request a new legal requirement to register, classify, and subsequently surveil white supremacist organizations as domestic terrorist organizations. By classifying these groups as intimidating to the American population and dangerous to human life, the institutions responsible for protecting citizens against such groups will have the necessary information and resources to prevent further destruction carried out by these violent terrorist groups.

13.title: 22 Maps & Charts Explaining Mass Incarceration
13.subtitle: America is number one — in incarceration. Over the past several decades, the country has built the largest prison population in the entire world, with the second-highest prison population per capita behind the tiny African country of Seychelles. But how did it get this way?

14.title: Swimming caps designed for natural hair banned from Tokyo Olympic Games
14.subtitle: Swimming caps designed for natural Black hair — and created by a Black-owned company — will not be allowed at the upcoming Olympic Games in Tokyo. The International Swimming Federation said the caps do not follow "the natural form of the head," British brand Soul Cap told BBC News.

14.title: Let Sha'Carri Run!
14.subtitle: Sign the petition to reinstate Sha'Carri Richardson and allow this world-class athlete to compete in the 100-meter dash! And revisit the outdated rules around marijuana and athletes.

15.title: Not all Black people are African American. Here's the difference.
15.subtitle: Black Lives Matter protests have opened up conversations about the history of privilege, racism, and the lived experiences and identities of black people in America. Now, the distinction between "Black" and "African American" has become a prominent conversation on social media.

15.title: #ChooseToChallenge - International Women's Day
15.subtitle: A challenged world is an alert world. Individually, we're all responsible for our own thoughts and actions - all day, every day. We can all choose to challenge and call out gender bias and inequality. We can all choose to seek out and celebrate women's achievements. Collectively, we can all help create an inclusive world. From challenge comes change, so let's all choose to challenge.

16.title: Iltopia Studios
16.subtitle: Iltopia Studios is a small creative studio based in Portland, Oregon. Our objective is simple: make comics and cartoons that open doors to more understanding. Iltopia Studios is dedicated to producing engaging content to our customers at a high quality and a variety of price points. Founded by creator Steven Christian. His goal is to create quirky adventure stories about the Black experience in America that entertains, empowers, and educates. We make cartoons and comics with emerging technology to provide unique and immersive storytelling experiences.

products.name: Cutie Catcher Pack #1
products.description: This Sticker Pack is collections handcrafted stickers by artist Steven Christian. The designs are based on cartoon and comic Eyelnd Feevr.  All sticker are 4” tall, hand cut, and hand laminated. They are great for placing on laptops, skateboards, water bottles, etc. With all the available designs, there is no limit to where you can place them!

products.name: Black Superheroes Matter Artbook
products.description: Black Superheroes Matter Artbook is the original illustration series by Steven Christian aimed at redefining popular superheroes through the eyes of black children. The book includes 110 full color illustrations ranging from anime to Power Rangers. This quirky collection of illustrations is guaranteed to empower and inspire you to redefine you own heroes in your image. Each book is handmade, numbered, and signed by artist Steven Christian.

products.name: Eyelnd Feevr Season 1: Big City, Small Dreemz
products.description: Big City, Small Dreemz is the first Season in the Eyelnd Feevr Webseries. It introduces us to Roscoe Thomason an intelligent, precocious and rebellious 9-year-old. He explores one of his wildest dreams with his best friend Thomas "T.J." Jenkins. As they try to find the true meaning, one must wonder if this is figment of Roscoe's wild imagination or a foreshadowing of what is to come.

17.title: The RACE Method Of Talking To A Racism Skeptic
17.subtitle: The RACE Method is an approach that anti-racism allies can take to trying to share their perspective with people who are skeptical that racism against people of color is a problem worthy of specific attention. It is based on principles from non-violent communication and on findings from the science of persuasion.

17.title: Aloha Glamour
17.subtitle:
Aloha Glamour is a lifestyle movement that promotes women loving themselves wholeheartedly. We are a community of women that empower others to use find and use their voice to turn their tragedies into triumphs and their mess into a message which enables them to build from the inside out...seeing and LIVING in color again. 

Thanks to our inspiring collections and our impeccable customer service, we have been highly successful since day one. Browse through our site and check out the latest additions to our collection, and feel free to get in touch with our team if you need any assistance.

We want you to create a story in each and every Aloha Glamour piece that you wear. What's the color of your story?

Stats and myths collide in this fascinating talk that ends with a remarkable insight.

Encinia was never indicted, in spite of the fact, that he physically assaulted her her on camera. There is a new video that has come to light, which may have been hidden from the grand jury.

23.subtitle: She was big and brown and built high off the ground — "a hell of a woman," men called her, but most women said she was "rough." And while there were other blues singers in the first half of the 20th century — some who shared her surname — none could be mistaken for Bessie Smith.

24.title: The Other Wes Moore
24.subtitle: Two kids named Wes Moore were born blocks apart within a year of each other. Both grew up fatherless in similar Baltimore neighborhoods and had difficult childhoods; both hung out on street corners with their crews; both ran into trouble with the police. How, then, did one grow up to be a Rhodes Scholar, decorated veteran, White House Fellow, and business leader, while the other ended up a convicted murderer serving a life sentence?

products.name: 18" African American Fashion Doll- Kaila Bradley

products.description: Mist our handcrafted linen sprays into the air liberally to Relax, Balance or Uplift your senses. When misting Linen, Spray 7 inches away and only on washable fabric. Contains essential oils/highly quality fragrance oils.

products.name: 8oz. Herbal Candles
products.description: The Amazing Essence 8 oz. herbal candles are handcrafted using natural soy wax, and fused with dried herbs, high quality fragrance oils without phthalates and a natural cotton wick to ensure a clean, toxic-free burn in your home or office. Approx 40hr of burn time.
